data.title: Don Davis (United Sound) reels
data.meta_description: In the recent UNH show, George once again sang the chorus to Doing It In The Mud right after the one hour mark. I then happened to search online and came across an auction that had the reels! :astonished: … but it ended …
data.text:
In the recent UNH show, George once again sang the chorus to Doing It In The Mud right after the one hour mark. I then happened to search online and came across an auction that had the reels! … but it ended over a week ago, so I was pretty bummed out about it , but I realized that there were quite a number of George reels that were auctioned over the past few years by Carolina Soul Records, in relation to the estate of Don Davis (Groovesville Productions, Detroit, MI).

I was surprised no one brought it up here, so I decided to compile a list of the tracks on the reels. I tried to order them chronologically as best I could, based on the bits and pieces of information out there. If the picture’s text was too blurry, I put it in brackets.

Drop, Drop or Hot Ice related to The Chong Show (1979), Melting In Your Heart (1977), the Family Series, Hard (1988) or Faucet (2018)?

Auction: 2023-05-19, BOOGIE FUNK 1-SONG MASTER REEL: GEORGE CLINTON “FREAKS”

CLIENT: [?] [?]

ARTIST: [?] [?]

ENGINEER: [?]

DATE: [?]

Freaks

It’s great you made out those track titles you did, I just used a computer graphics program and can’t make it out either.

I did contact Carolina Soul Records who were selling the reels, they said that was the last of the Don Davis tapes they had in for now.

I do remember Claudia White from The Inc Thang Band saying she recorded with a girl group and Andre Foxxe in the early 80’s in United Sound studios. Don didn’t think they were ready, so didn’t put any of their music out. I don’t think any of those tracks have shown up for sale.

"Client: GEORGE CLINTON

Artist: [?] ([?] [?])

ENGINEER: [?] [?]y

Date: 8/15/85

“Drums” Inst. Rough mixes

“Drums” VOCAL Rough mixes"

This one could be Primal Instinct Loic Gambas said he made it with Amp Fiddler in 1985, then George finished the track in L.A. Amp was from Detroit so he must have recorded at United Sounds at some point.
